alert.note: Alert for Holmes; Jackson; Washington (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 03 at 6:14PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Jackson, southeastern Holmes and northeastern Washington Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 513 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Chipley to near Bonifay. Movement was east at 5 mph. At 458 PM CDT the Holmes County Airport measured a wind gust near 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Chipley, Bonifay, Cottondale, Richter Crossroads, Jacob City, Chipley Municipal Airport, Kynesville, Holmes County Airport, Steele City, Cottondale Airport, Jacobs, Bahoma, Poplar Head and Johnson Crossroads. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
